verses.verse: The king's <S%H4428><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%> is in the hand <S%H3027><s%> of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>, as the rivers <S%H6388><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>: he turneth <S%H5186><s%> it whithersoever he will <S%H2654><s%>.
Every way <S%H1870><s%> of a man <S%H376><s%> is right <S%H3477><s%> in his own eyes <S%H5869><s%>: but the LORD <S%H3068><s%> pondereth <S%H8505><s%> the hearts <S%H3826><s%>.
To do <S%H6213><s%> justice <S%H6666><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%> is more acceptable <S%H977><s%> to the LORD <S%H3068><s%> than sacrifice <S%H2077><s%>.

An high <S%H7312><s%> look <S%H5869><s%>, and a proud <S%H7342><s%> heart <S%H3820><s%>, and the plowing <S%H5215><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, is sin <S%H2403><s%>. An: Heb. Haughtiness of eyes the plowing: or, the light
The thoughts <S%H4284><s%> of the diligent <S%H2742><s%> tend only to plenteousness <S%H4195><s%>; but of every one that is hasty <S%H213><s%> only to want <S%H4270><s%>.

The getting <S%H6467><s%> of treasures <S%H214><s%> by a lying <S%H8267><s%> tongue <S%H3956><s%> is a vanity <S%H1892><s%> tossed to and fro of <S%H5086><s%> them that seek <S%H1245><s%> death <S%H4194><s%>.

The robbery <S%H7701><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall destroy <S%H1641><s%> them; because they refuse <S%H3985><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%>. destroy: Heb. saw them, or, dwell with them
The way <S%H1870><s%> of man <S%H376><s%> is froward <S%H2019><s%> and strange <S%H2054><s%>: but as for the pure <S%H2134><s%>, his work <S%H6467><s%> is right <S%H3477><s%>.

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in a corner <S%H6438><s%> of the housetop <S%H1406><s%>, than with a brawling <S%H4079><s%> <S%H4066><s%> woman <S%H802><s%> in a wide <S%H2267><s%> house <S%H1004><s%>. a brawling: Heb. a woman of contentions a wide: Heb. an house of society

The soul <S%H5315><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> desireth <S%H183><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>: his neighbour <S%H7453><s%> findeth no favour <S%H2603><s%> in his eyes <S%H5869><s%>. findeth: Heb. is not favoured

When the scorner <S%H3887><s%> is punished <S%H6064><s%>, the simple <S%H6612><s%> is made wise <S%H2449><s%>: and when the wise <S%H2450><s%> is instructed <S%H7919><s%>, he receiveth <S%H3947><s%> knowledge <S%H1847><s%>.

The righteous <S%H6662><s%> man wisely considereth <S%H7919><s%> the house <S%H1004><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%>: but God overthroweth <S%H5557><s%> the wicked <S%H7563><s%> for their wickedness <S%H7451><s%>.
Whoso stoppeth <S%H331><s%> his ears <S%H241><s%> at the cry <S%H2201><s%> of the poor <S%H1800><s%>, he also shall cry <S%H7121><s%> himself, but shall not be heard <S%H6030><s%>.
A gift <S%H4976><s%> in secret <S%H5643><s%> pacifieth <S%H3711><s%> anger <S%H639><s%>: and a reward <S%H7810><s%> in the bosom <S%H2436><s%> strong <S%H5794><s%> wrath <S%H2534><s%>.
It is joy <S%H8057><s%> to the just <S%H6662><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%> judgment <S%H4941><s%>: but destruction <S%H4288><s%> shall be to the workers <S%H6466><s%> of iniquity <S%H205><s%>.
The man <S%H120><s%> that wandereth <S%H8582><s%> out of the way <S%H1870><s%> of understanding <S%H7919><s%> shall remain <S%H5117><s%> in the congregation <S%H6951><s%> of the dead <S%H7496><s%>.

He that loveth <S%H157><s%> pleasure <S%H8057><s%> shall be a poor <S%H4270><s%> man <S%H376><s%>: he that loveth <S%H157><s%> wine <S%H3196><s%> and oil <S%H8081><s%> shall not be rich <S%H6238><s%>. pleasure: or, sport
The wicked <S%H7563><s%> shall be a ransom <S%H3724><s%> for the righteous <S%H6662><s%>, and the transgressor <S%H898><s%> for the upright <S%H3477><s%>.

It is better <S%H2896><s%> to dwell <S%H3427><s%> in the wilderness <S%H776><s%> <S%H4057><s%>, than with a contentious <S%H4079><s%> <S%H4066><s%> and an angry <S%H3708><s%> woman <S%H802><s%>. in: Heb. in the land of the desert

There is treasure <S%H214><s%> to be desired <S%H2530><s%> and oil <S%H8081><s%> in the dwelling <S%H5116><s%> of the wise <S%H2450><s%>; but a foolish <S%H3684><s%> man <S%H120><s%> spendeth it up <S%H1104><s%>.
He that followeth <S%H7291><s%> after righteousness <S%H6666><s%> and mercy <S%H2617><s%> findeth <S%H4672><s%> life <S%H2416><s%>, righteousness <S%H6666><s%>, and honour <S%H3519><s%>.
A wise <S%H2450><s%> man scaleth <S%H5927><s%> the city <S%H5892><s%> of the mighty <S%H1368><s%>, and casteth down <S%H3381><s%> the strength <S%H5797><s%> of the confidence <S%H4009><s%> thereof.
Whoso keepeth <S%H8104><s%> his mouth <S%H6310><s%> and his tongue <S%H3956><s%> keepeth <S%H8104><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> from troubles <S%H6869><s%>.

Proud <S%H2086><s%> and haughty <S%H3093><s%> scorner <S%H3887><s%> is his name <S%H8034><s%>, who dealeth <S%H6213><s%> in proud <S%H2087><s%> wrath <S%H5678><s%>. in proud: Heb. in the wrath of pride
The desire <S%H8378><s%> of the slothful <S%H6102><s%> killeth <S%H4191><s%> him; for his hands <S%H3027><s%> refuse <S%H3985><s%> to labour <S%H6213><s%>.
He coveteth <S%H183><s%> greedily <S%H8378><s%> all the day <S%H3117><s%> long: but the righteous <S%H6662><s%> giveth <S%H5414><s%> and spareth <S%H2820><s%> not.
The sacrifice <S%H2077><s%> of the wicked <S%H7563><s%> is abomination <S%H8441><s%>: how much more, when he bringeth <S%H935><s%> it with a wicked mind <S%H2154><s%>? with: Heb. in wickedness?
A false <S%H3577><s%> witness <S%H5707><s%> shall perish <S%H6><s%>: but the man <S%H376><s%> that heareth <S%H8085><s%> speaketh <S%H1696><s%> constantly <S%H5331><s%>. A: Heb. A witness of lies

A wicked <S%H7563><s%> man <S%H376><s%> hardeneth <S%H5810><s%> his face <S%H6440><s%>: but as for the upright <S%H3477><s%>, he directeth <S%H995><s%> <S%H3559><s%> his way <S%H1870><s%>. directeth: or, considereth
There is no wisdom <S%H2451><s%> nor understanding <S%H8394><s%> nor counsel <S%H6098><s%> against the LORD <S%H3068><s%>.
The horse <S%H5483><s%> is prepared <S%H3559><s%> against the day <S%H3117><s%> of battle <S%H4421><s%>: but safety <S%H8668><s%> is of the LORD <S%H3068><s%>. safety: or, victory
